title: Walloon language
summary: Walloon (/wɒˈluːn/; natively walon) is a Romance language that is spoken in much of Wallonia and (to small extent) in Brussels, Belgium; some villages near Givet, northern France; a clutch of communities in northeastern Wisconsin, U.S.;[2] and in some parts of Canada. It belongs to the langue d'oïl language family, the most prominent member of which is French. The historical background of its formation was the territorial extension since 980 of the Principality of Liège to the south and west.
